Eric Schmidt has been Google's chief executive since July 2001, when he took over the role from Mr. Page and ushered the company through a public offering. More recently, he has Mr. Page said Eric Schmidt had done an outstanding job leading Google for the last decade. The results speak for themselves. Google's other co-founder Sergey Brin will focus on strategic projects and new products, the company said. Although he tried to debunk the idea in Thursday's interview, Eric Schmidt may have been growing weary of all the attention and prosaic duties that come with running one of world's most scrutinized companies. I don't think Eric Schmidt was pushed. I think he jumped, said Ken Auletta , author of "Googled: The End of the World As We Know It." "I think Eric Schmidt is burned out." American companies in the face of economic and global shocks that are out of their control, such as spiraling oil prices or another recession. Chrysler, which remains the weakest of the three, now has enough resources to deal with another recession, Sergio Marchionne said. And the company is launching more fuel-efficient powertrains so that customers won't flee to other brands as gas prices rise, he said.
